trans-unit.source: Using the AS2 Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the AS2 Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the AS2 connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the AS2 connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Use the AS2 Connector to receive and send messages over the AS2 (Applicability Statement 2) transport protocol in business-to-business communications.
trans-unit.target: Use the AS2 Connector to receive and send messages over the AS2 (Applicability Statement 2) transport protocol in business-to-business communications.

trans-unit.source: Data is transported securely and reliably over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: Data is transported securely and reliably over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Security is achieved using digital certificates and encryption.
trans-unit.target: Security is achieved using digital certificates and encryption.

trans-unit.source: You can add the AS2 Connecto to your business workflow and process data as part of a business-to-business workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the AS2 Connecto to your business workflow and process data as part of a business-to-business workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: A Trigger starts a new instance based on a specific event, like the arrival of an AS2 message from a partner.
trans-unit.target: A Trigger starts a new instance based on a specific event, like the arrival of an AS2 message from a partner.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result, like after receiving an AS2 message, then send the message using AS2.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result, like after receiving an AS2 message, then send the message using AS2.

trans-unit.source: The AS2 Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The AS2 Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: The AS2 Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The AS2 Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: Receive & Decode
trans-unit.target: Receive & Decode

trans-unit.source: Encode & Send
trans-unit.target: Encode & Send

trans-unit.source: The following items must be created by you before they can be used by the AS2 connector:
trans-unit.target: The following items must be created by you before they can be used by the AS2 connector:

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: TPM API App
trans-unit.target: TPM API App

trans-unit.source: Before creating an AS2 connector, you have to create a <linkText>BizTalk Trading Partner Management Connector[1]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Before creating an AS2 connector, you have to create a <linkText>BizTalk Trading Partner Management Connector[1]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Note Know the name of your TPM API App.
trans-unit.target: Note Know the name of your TPM API App.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Stores B2B items including partners, schemas, certificates, and agreeements.
trans-unit.target: Stores B2B items including partners, schemas, certificates, and agreeements.

trans-unit.source: Each of the B2B API Apps requires its own Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Each of the B2B API Apps requires its own Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source:
Note Copy the connection string to this database.

Create an Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target:
Note Copy the connection string to this database.

Create an Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob Storage container
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob Storage container

trans-unit.source: Stores message properties when AS2 archiving is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Stores message properties when AS2 archiving is enabled.

trans-unit.source: If you don't need AS2 message archiving, a Storage container is not needed.
trans-unit.target: If you don't need AS2 message archiving, a Storage container is not needed.

trans-unit.source:
Note If you are enabling archiving, copy the connection string to this Blob Storage.

About Azure Storage Accounts.
trans-unit.target:
Note If you are enabling archiving, copy the connection string to this Blob Storage.

About Azure Storage Accounts.

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Search for “AS2 Connector”, select it, and select Create.
trans-unit.target: Search for “AS2 Connector”, select it, and select Create.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following package settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following package settings:

trans-unit.source: Property | Description --- | --- Database Connection String | Enter the ADO.NET connection string to the Azure SQL Database you created.
trans-unit.target: Property | Description --- | --- Database Connection String | Enter the ADO.NET connection string to the Azure SQL Database you created.

trans-unit.source: When you copy the connection string, the password is not added to the connection string.
trans-unit.target: When you copy the connection string, the password is not added to the connection string.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to enter the password in the connection string before you paste.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to enter the password in the connection string before you paste.

trans-unit.source: Enable Archiving for incoming messages | Optional.
trans-unit.target: Enable Archiving for incoming messages | Optional.

trans-unit.source: Enable this property to store the message properties of an incoming AS2 message received from a partner.
trans-unit.target: Enable this property to store the message properties of an incoming AS2 message received from a partner.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob Storage Connection String | Enter the connection string to the Azure Blob Storage container you created.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob Storage Connection String | Enter the connection string to the Azure Blob Storage container you created.

trans-unit.source: When Archiving is enabled, the encoded and decoded messages are stored in this Storage container.
trans-unit.target: When Archiving is enabled, the encoded and decoded messages are stored in this Storage container.

trans-unit.source: TPM Instance Name | Enter the name of the BizTalk Trading Partner Management API App you previously created.
trans-unit.target: TPM Instance Name | Enter the name of the BizTalk Trading Partner Management API App you previously created.

trans-unit.source: When you create the AS2 connector, this connector executes only the AS2 agreements within this specific TPM instance.
trans-unit.target: When you create the AS2 connector, this connector executes only the AS2 agreements within this specific TPM instance.

trans-unit.source: Select Create.
trans-unit.target: Select Create.

trans-unit.source: Trading partners are the entities involved in B2B (Business-to-Business) communications.
trans-unit.target: Trading partners are the entities involved in B2B (Business-to-Business) communications.

trans-unit.source: When two partners establish a relationship, this is referred to as an Agreement.
trans-unit.target: When two partners establish a relationship, this is referred to as an Agreement.

trans-unit.source: The agreement defined is based on the communication the two partners wish to achieve and is protocol or transport specific.
trans-unit.target: The agreement defined is based on the communication the two partners wish to achieve and is protocol or transport specific.

trans-unit.source: Steps involved in creating a trading partner agreement are documented <linkText>here[2]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Steps involved in creating a trading partner agreement are documented <linkText>here[2]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When creating or editing a logic app, select the AS2 Connector you created from the right pane: <linkText>Trigger settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: When creating or editing a logic app, select the AS2 Connector you created from the right pane: <linkText>Trigger settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the right arrow →: <linkText>Trigger options</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click the right arrow →: <linkText>Trigger options</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The AS2 Connector exposes a single trigger. Select Receive & Decode: Receive and decode input
trans-unit.target: The AS2 Connector exposes a single trigger. Select Receive & Decode: Receive and decode input

trans-unit.source: This trigger has no inputs.
trans-unit.target: This trigger has no inputs.

trans-unit.source: Click the right arrow →: <linkText>Receive and decode configured</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click the right arrow →: <linkText>Receive and decode configured</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As part of the output, the connector returns the AS2 payload as well as the AS2-specific metadata.
trans-unit.target: As part of the output, the connector returns the AS2 payload as well as the AS2-specific metadata.

trans-unit.source: The Trigger is fired when an AS2 Payload is as a POST to https://{Host URL}/decode.
trans-unit.target: The Trigger is fired when an AS2 Payload is as a POST to https://{Host URL}/decode.

trans-unit.source: You can find the Host URL in the API App settings.
trans-unit.target: You can find the Host URL in the API App settings.

trans-unit.source: You may also need to change the Access Level of the API App in Application Settings to Public (authenticated or anonymous).
trans-unit.target: You may also need to change the Access Level of the API App in Application Settings to Public (authenticated or anonymous).

trans-unit.source: After your trigger (or choose 'run this logic manually'), add the AS2 connector you created from the right pane: <linkText>Action settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: After your trigger (or choose 'run this logic manually'), add the AS2 connector you created from the right pane: <linkText>Action settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the right arrow →: <linkText>List of Actions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Click the right arrow →: <linkText>List of Actions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The AS2 connector supports only one action.
trans-unit.target: The AS2 connector supports only one action.

trans-unit.source: Select Encode and Send: Encode and send input
trans-unit.target: Select Encode and Send: Encode and send input

trans-unit.source: Enter the inputs for the action and configure it: <linkText>Encode and send configured</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Enter the inputs for the action and configure it: <linkText>Encode and send configured</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Parameters include:
trans-unit.target: Parameters include:

trans-unit.source: Parameter | Type | Description --- | --- | --- Payload | object| The content of the payload to encode and post to the configured end point.
trans-unit.target: Parameter | Type | Description --- | --- | --- Payload | object| The content of the payload to encode and post to the configured end point.

trans-unit.source: The payload needs to be provided as a JSON Object.
trans-unit.target: The payload needs to be provided as a JSON Object.

trans-unit.source: AS2 From | string | The AS2 identity of the sender of the AS2 message.
trans-unit.target: AS2 From | string | The AS2 identity of the sender of the AS2 message.

trans-unit.source: This parameter is used to lookup the appropriate agreement for sending the message.
trans-unit.target: This parameter is used to lookup the appropriate agreement for sending the message.

trans-unit.source: AS2 To | string | The AS2 identity of the receiver of the AS2 message.
trans-unit.target: AS2 To | string | The AS2 identity of the receiver of the AS2 message.

trans-unit.source: This parameter is used to lookup the appropriate agreement for sending the message.
trans-unit.target: This parameter is used to lookup the appropriate agreement for sending the message.

trans-unit.source: Partner URL | string | The end point of the partner to which the message needs to be sent.
trans-unit.target: Partner URL | string | The end point of the partner to which the message needs to be sent.

trans-unit.source: Enable Archiving | boolean | Determines if the outbound message should be archived.
trans-unit.target: Enable Archiving | boolean | Determines if the outbound message should be archived.

trans-unit.source: The action returns a HTTP 200 response code on successful completion.
trans-unit.target: The action returns a HTTP 200 response code on successful completion.

trans-unit.source: More on logic apps at <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: More on logic apps at <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
